name: help
help: Show help for the Microsoft Power Platform CLI

name: package
help: Commands for working with Dataverse package projects

verbs.name: init
verbs.help: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse package project

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.name: --package-name
arguments.help: Sets the default name of the package. Applies to the generation of ImportExtension.GetNameOfImport.

verbs.name: add-external-package
verbs.help: Adds a package that is external to the Dataverse solution system to a PD Package project

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to the external package

arguments.name: --package-type
arguments.help: The type of the package being added. e.g. 'xpp' for FnO packages.

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --skip-validation
arguments.help: Adds the item to the project file even if the file does not exist or appears to be invalid. Note, this will not affect any validation that is performed by MSBuild.

verbs.name: add-solution
verbs.help: Adds a prebuilt Dataverse solution file to a PD Package project

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Path to the Dataverse solution file (must be *.zip)

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --skip-validation
arguments.help: Adds the item to the project file even if the file does not exist or appears to be invalid. Note, this will not affect any validation that is performed by MSBuild.

arguments.name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --import-mode
arguments.help: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution.

arguments.name: --missing-dependency-behavior
arguments.help: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment.

arguments.name: --dependency-overrides
arguments.help: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: `<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>`. Where the minVersion and maxVersion is optional but should be in .Net version format syntax.
arguments.RegexHelp: Use a semicolon delimited list of dependency overrides of the format <uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>.

verbs.name: add-reference
verbs.help: Adds reference to Dataverse solution project

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: The path to the referenced Dataverse solution project

arguments.name: --import-order
arguments.help: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

arguments.name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
arguments.help: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported.

arguments.name: --import-mode
arguments.help: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution.

arguments.name: --missing-dependency-behavior
arguments.help: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment.

arguments.name: --dependency-overrides
arguments.help: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: `<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>`. Where the minVersion and maxVersion is optional but should be in .Net version format syntax.
arguments.RegexHelp: Use a semicolon delimited list of dependency overrides of the format <uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>.

arguments.name: --logFile
arguments.help: Log file path

arguments.name: --logConsole
arguments.help: Output log to console

arguments.name: --package
arguments.help: path to a package dll or zip file with a package

arguments.name: --settings
arguments.help: Runtime Package Settings that are passed to the package that is being deployed.  The format of the string must be `key=value|key=value`.
arguments.RegexHelp: The format of the string must be `key=value|key=value`.

arguments.name: --verbose
arguments.help: Emit Verbose logs to the log outputs

arguments.name: --package
arguments.help: path to a package dll or zip file with a package

arguments.name: --logFile
arguments.help: Log file path

arguments.name: --verbose
arguments.help: Emit Verbose logs to the log outputs

name: pcf
help: Commands for working with Power Apps component framework projects

verbs.name: init
verbs.help: Initializes a directory with a new Power Apps component framework project

arguments.name: --namespace
arguments.help: The namespace for the component
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], [0 - 9], or '.' are allowed. The first and last character may not be the '.' character. Consecutive '.' characters are not allowed. Numbers are not allowed as the first character or immediately after a period.

arguments.name: --name
arguments.help: The name for the component
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z] or [0 - 9] are allowed. The first character may not be a number.

arguments.name: --template
arguments.help: Choose a template for the component

arguments.name: --framework
arguments.help: The rendering framework for control. Default value is 'none' [none: HTML, react: React]

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

arguments.name: --run-npm-install
arguments.help: Auto run 'npm install' after the control is created. Default value is 'false'

arguments.name: --strategy
arguments.help: Updates patch version for 'ControlManifest.xml' files using specified strategy. If using gittags, set personal access token in the following environment variable "PacCli.PAT"

arguments.name: --patchversion
arguments.help: Patch version for controls
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: Absolute/Relative path of the 'ControlManifest.xml' for updating.

arguments.name: --allmanifests
arguments.help: Updates patch version for all 'ControlManifest.xml' files

arguments.name: --updatetarget
arguments.help: Specify which target manifest needs to be updated

arguments.name: --filename
arguments.help: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. Default value is ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv

name: solution
help: Commands for working with Dataverse solution projects

verbs.name: init
verbs.help: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse solution project

arguments.name: --publisher-name
arguments.help: Name of the Dataverse solution publisher
arguments.RegexHelp: Only characters within the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], [0 - 9], or _ are allowed. The first character may only be in the ranges [A - Z], [a - z], or _.

arguments.name: --publisher-prefix
arguments.help: Customization prefix value for the Dataverse solution publisher
arguments.RegexHelp: The prefix must be 2 to 8 characters long, can only consist of alpha-numerics, must start with a letter, and cannot start with 'mscrm'.

arguments.name: --outputDirectory
arguments.help: Output directory

verbs.name: add-reference
verbs.help: Adds a reference from the project in the current directory to the project at 'path'

arguments.name: --path
arguments.help: The path to the referenced project

verbs.name: list
verbs.help: List all Solutions from the current Dataverse Organization

arguments.name: --environment-id
arguments.help: The target Environment ID.  Default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

arguments.name: --environment
arguments.help: The target Environment ID or URL.  Default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

verbs.name: delete
verbs.help: Delete solution from Dataverse in the current Environment.

arguments.name: --solution-name
arguments.help: Name of the solution

verbs.name: online-version
verbs.help: Sets version for solution loaded in Dataverse.

arguments.name: --solution-name
arguments.help: Name of the solution

arguments.name: --solution-version
arguments.help: Specify the solution version number.

verbs.name: version
verbs.help: Update build or revision version for solution

arguments.name: --strategy
arguments.help: Updates build version for 'Solution.xml' file using specified strategy. If using gittags, set personal access token in the following environment variable "PacCli.PAT"

arguments.name: --patchversion
arguments.help: Patch version for solution

arguments.name: --buildversion
arguments.help: Build version for solution
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer

arguments.name: --revisionversion
arguments.help: Revision version for solution
arguments.RegexHelp: The value must be a positive integer

arguments.name: --filename
arguments.help: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. Default value is ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv

arguments.name: --solutionPath
arguments.help: Path to Dataverse solution directory or Solution.xml file.

verbs.name: pack
verbs.help: Package solution components on local filesystem into solution.zip (SolutionPackager)

arguments.name: --zipfile
arguments.help: The full path to the solution ZIP file

arguments.name: --folder
arguments.help: The path to the root folder on the local filesystem. When unpacking/extractins, this will be written to, when packing this will be read from.

arguments.name: --packagetype
arguments.help: When unpacking/extracting, use to specify dual Managed and Unmanaged operation. When packing, use to specify Managed or Unmanaged from a previous unpack 'Both'. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'; default: 'Unmanaged'

arguments.name: --log
arguments.help: The path to the log file.

arguments.name: --errorlevel
arguments.help: Minimum logging level for log output [Verbose|Info|Warning|Error|Off]; default: Info

arguments.name: --singleComponent
arguments.help: Only perform action on a single component type [WebResource|Plugin|Workflow|None]; default: None.

arguments.name: --allowDelete
arguments.help: Dictates if delete operations may occur; default: false.

arguments.name: --allowWrite
arguments.help: Dictates if write operations may occur; default: false.

arguments.name: --clobber
arguments.help: Enables that files marked read-only can be deleted or overwritten; default: false.

arguments.name: --map
arguments.help: The full path to a mapping xml file from which to read component folders to pack.

arguments.name: --sourceLoc
arguments.help: Generates a template resource file. Valid only on Extract. Possible Values are auto or an LCID/ISO code of the language you wish to export. When Present, this will extract the string resources from the given locale as a neutral .resx. If auto or just the long or short form of the switch is specified the base locale for the solution will be used.

arguments.name: --localize
arguments.help: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files.

arguments.name: --useLcid
arguments.help: Use LCID's (1033) rather than ISO codes (en-US) for language files.

arguments.name: --useUnmanagedFileForMissingManaged
arguments.help: Use the same XML source file when packaging for Managed and only Unmanaged XML file is found; applies to AppModuleSiteMap, AppModuleMap, FormXml files

arguments.name: --disablePluginRemap
arguments.help: Disabled plug-in fully qualified type name remapping. default: false

arguments.name: --processCanvasApps
arguments.help: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. default: false

verbs.name: unpack
verbs.help: Extract solution components from solution.zip onto local filesystem (SolutionPackager)

arguments.name: --zipfile
arguments.help: The full path to the solution ZIP file

arguments.name: --folder
arguments.help: The path to the root folder on the local filesystem. When unpacking/extractins, this will be written to, when packing this will be read from.

arguments.name: --packagetype
arguments.help: When unpacking/extracting, use to specify dual Managed and Unmanaged operation. When packing, use to specify Managed or Unmanaged from a previous unpack 'Both'. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'; default: 'Unmanaged'

arguments.name: --log
arguments.help: The path to the log file.

arguments.name: --errorlevel
arguments.help: Minimum logging level for log output [Verbose|Info|Warning|Error|Off]; default: Info

arguments.name: --singleComponent
arguments.help: Only perform action on a single component type [WebResource|Plugin|Workflow|None]; default: None.

arguments.name: --allowDelete
arguments.help: Dictates if delete operations may occur; default: false.

arguments.name: --allowWrite
arguments.help: Dictates if write operations may occur; default: false.

arguments.name: --clobber
arguments.help: Enables that files marked read-only can be deleted or overwritten; default: false.

arguments.name: --map
arguments.help: The full path to a mapping xml file from which to read component folders to pack.

arguments.name: --sourceLoc
arguments.help: Generates a template resource file. Valid only on Extract. Possible Values are auto or an LCID/ISO code of the language you wish to export. When Present, this will extract the string resources from the given locale as a neutral .resx. If auto or just the long or short form of the switch is specified the base locale for the solution will be used.

arguments.name: --localize
arguments.help: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files.

arguments.name: --useLcid
arguments.help: Use LCID's (1033) rather than ISO codes (en-US) for language files.

arguments.name: --useUnmanagedFileForMissingManaged
arguments.help: Use the same XML source file when packaging for Managed and only Unmanaged XML file is found; applies to AppModuleSiteMap, AppModuleMap, FormXml files

arguments.name: --disablePluginRemap
arguments.help: Disabled plug-in fully qualified type name remapping. default: false

arguments.name: --processCanvasApps
arguments.help: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. default: false

verbs.name: enable
verbs.help: Choose to send usage information to help Microsoft improve this product

verbs.name: disable
verbs.help: Choose to not send usage information to help Microsoft improve this product

verbs.name: status
verbs.help: Show the current status of telemetry
